headline: Ookinete-specific expression with female gametocyte bias in Plasmodium berghei
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits dramatic ookinete-specific expression in Plasmodium berghei, reaching >2900 TPM in ookinetes compared to minimal expression in asexual blood stages.
  • Shows >100-fold upregulation in ookinetes versus other life cycle stages
  • Demonstrates female gametocyte bias with 6-fold higher expression than male gametocytes
  • Expression is regulated by AP2-O2 and AP2-O3 transcription factors
  • Exhibits early upregulation during gametocyte development with peak expression at 0 and 12 hours post-induction
The gene's temporal expression pattern suggests critical roles in mosquito-stage development, potentially involved in ookinete motility, invasion, or survival functions, with additional importance in female gametocyte biology and sexual differentiation processes.

topics.headline: Dramatic ookinete-specific expression regulated by AP2 transcription factors
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows >100-fold increased expression in ookinetes compared to other life cycle stages, with expression levels dramatically reduced in ap2-o2 and ap2-o3 knockout strains, indicating strong transcriptional regulation during mosquito-stage development.

topics.headline: Female gametocyte-biased expression and early gametocyte development
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene exhibits female gametocyte-specific expression with 6-fold higher levels than male gametocytes and shows early upregulation during rapamycin-induced gametocytogenesis with peak expression at 0 and 12 hours post-induction.

topics.headline: Temporal expression pattern during liver stage development
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows highest expression in sporozoites followed by dramatic silencing at 6 hours post-infection, then gradually increases throughout liver stage development from 24-60 hours.
